item.title: G7 warns Russia of fresh sanctions
item.description: Leaders of the G7 industrial nations warn Russia of further sanctions over its actions in Ukraine, as a Brussels summit gets under way.

item.title: Manhunt as police shot in Canada
item.description: A manhunt is under way in the Canadian city of Moncton, New Brunswick, as a roaming gunman kills three police officers and wounds two more.

item.title: Bergdahl home town cancels welcome
item.description: The home town of Bowe Bergdahl, the US soldier freed from Afghan captivity, cancels a welcome rally over safety concerns, amid allegations he deserted.

item.title: China and US in spat over Tiananmen
item.description: China says it has lodged "solemn representations" with the US after the White House urged it to account for the Tiananmen massacre.

item.title: D-Day veterans attending events
item.description: Events marking the 70th anniversary of D-Day are taking place ahead of Friday's major commemoration on Sword Beach in Normandy.

item.title: Thai junta 'backed by neighbours'
item.description: Thailand's ruling junta says neighbouring countries support the military government, as the generals continue to seek legitimacy.

item.title: US military jet crashes into homes
item.description: A US military Harrier jet crashes into homes in Imperial, southern California, setting them on fire, after the pilot ejects.

item.title: Sterling agrees to Clippers sale
item.description: Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling agrees to sell the team for $2bn (£1.2bn) and drop his lawsuit against the league, his lawyer says.

item.title: Last creator of Navajo WW2 cipher dies
item.description: The last of the 29 Navajo Americans who developed a code with their native language to encrypt military messages in World War 2 has died at the age of 93.

item.title: ECB set for rate cut to boost growth
item.description: The European Central Bank is widely predicted to slash its interest rates on Thursday, as the economic recovery in the eurozone continues to be lacklustre

item.title: Camel infection 'led to Mers death'
item.description: Doctors believe they have found the first evidence that a new deadly virus in the Middle East has been transmitted from a camel to people.

item.title: Missing couple in 'Taliban' video
item.description: An American woman and a Canadian man who went missing in Afghanistan in 2012 are shown captive on videos released by their families.

item.title: Germany seeks employee-friendly army
item.description: The German army is to spend 100m euros on making itself a more attractive employer, with better childcare facilities and more user-friendly barracks.

item.title: Jolie: 'Most fans are just wonderful'
item.description: Angelina Jolie says her security arrangement will not change following Ukrainian prankster Vitalii Sediuk's red carpet 'attack' on Brad Pitt at the premiere of Maleficent.

item.title: Russian fighter intercepted US plane
item.description: A Russian fighter jet flew within 100ft (30m) of a US Air Force plane over international waters near Japan in April, the Pentagon says.

item.title: VIDEO: US wedding couple make a splash
item.description: A couple who decided to take the plunge and tie the knot, got more than they bargained for on their wedding day.

item.title: Brazil defends World Cup preparation
item.description: Brazil's President Dilma Rousseff defends her government's handling of preparations for the World Cup, which starts in Sao Paulo next week.

item.title: Mexico doubles sentences for kidnap
item.description: Mexico increases minimum prison sentences for kidnapping to 40 years after a dramatic surge in the crime in recent years.

item.title: Ebola death toll hits 208 in Guinea
item.description: Some 208 people have now died from the Ebola virus in Guinea after a deadly spike in cases in recent days, world health officials say.

item.title: Blast targets rogue Libya general
item.description: A suicide bomb attack at the home of a rogue Libyan general - who has been fighting Islamist militia - kills four people.

item.title: Polls test S Korea mood after ferry
item.description: South Korea's ruling conservative party makes a strong showing in local elections, despite criticism over its handling of the recent ferry disaster.

item.title: Malaysia backpacker police find body
item.description: A body is found in the hunt for British backpacker Gareth Huntley who went missing while trekking on a Malaysian island.

item.title: Premier League revenues break £3bn
item.description: Premier League clubs' revenues broke through the £3bn mark in the recent 2013-14 season, say analysts Deloitte.

item.title: Irish consider child deaths inquiry
item.description: Ireland considers an inquiry after the remains of nearly 800 children are discovered buried in the grounds of a former Catholic institution.

item.title: Syria's Bashar al-Assad re-elected
item.description: President Bashar al-Assad has won a third term in office after securing 88.7% of votes cast in Syria's election, the parliamentary speaker says.

item.title: Fifa set to probe Qatar officials
item.description: Fifa are set to question Qatar officials after claims about the legality of the bidding process for the 2022 World Cup.

item.title: Feed firm 'saddened' by baby death
item.description: The manufacturer of a hospital feed "strongly linked" to the death of one baby and illness of 14 others says it is "saddened" by what has happened.

item.title: £1bn 'shortfall' in PPI compensation
item.description: Some major banks may have underpaid by up to £1bn the compensation certain customers are due for mis-sold Payment Protection Insurance, the BBC learns.

item.title: GSK agrees $105m US settlement
item.description: UK drugs giant GlaxoSmithKline agrees a $105m settlement with 44 US states over allegations it mis-promoted three drugs including asthma medication Advair.

item.title: Alibaba buys Chinese football stake
item.description: Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba buys a 50% stake in Guangzhou Evergrande Football Club for a reported 1.2 billion yuan ($192m; £114m)

item.title: Australia beats growth forecast
item.description: Australia's economy grows more than forecast in the first three months of the year, boosted by a rise in exports and domestic consumption.

item.title: Ecuador 2-2 England
item.description: Raheem Sterling is sent off and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain is injured as England are held to a 2-2 draw by Ecuador in Miami.

item.title: Murray battles through in Paris gloom
item.description: Andy Murray produces a late surge to beat Gael Monfils in five sets and reach the French Open semi-finals.

item.title: Jordan eyes England Test call-up
item.description: Chris Jordan hopes for a Test call-up when England name their squad on Thursday for a two-match series with Sri Lanka.

item.title: Eimear McBride wins Baileys prize
item.description: Irish author Eimear McBride wins the Baileys Women's Prize for Fiction with A Girl is a Half-Formed Thing, the debut novel she spent nine years trying to get published.

item.title: RA's 'sprawling' Summer Exhibition
item.description: Works of particular interest from this year's sprawling 1,200-piece Summer Exhibition at London's Royal Academy.

item.title: Frozen creators plan stage musical
item.description: The Oscar-winning creators of the animation Frozen are planning a stage musical entitled Up Here, the show's producer says.

item.title: VIDEO: US military jet crashes into homes
item.description: A US military jet has crashed into homes in the California desert, about 90 miles (144km) east of San Diego.

item.title: VIDEO: Hong Kong marks Tiananmen anniversary
item.description: Tens of thousands have gathered in Hong Kong for the only major commemoration in China of the 25th anniversary of the Tiananmen Square massacre in Beijing.

item.title: VIDEO: Irish consider child deaths inquiry
item.description: The Irish government is considering opening an inquiry after the remains of nearly 800 children were found in an unmarked grave.

item.title: VIDEO: Giant hail and winds pummel Nebraska
item.description: Giant hail has pummelled the US state of Nebraska, leaving vehicles and homes damaged.

item.title: VIDEO: Brazilians cool on cup fever
item.description: The World Cup in Brazil is just over a week away. But the country has faced problems with stadium delays, overspends and civil unrest

item.title: AUDIO: Bergdahl prisoner swap 'not ideal'
item.description: Admiral Mike Mullen says that the five senior Taliban prisoners, who were freed from Guantanamo Bay, last week could return to their leadership roles.

item.title: VIDEO: Boko Haram 'tricked villagers'
item.description: Peter Biye, a Member of the House of Representatives for Gwoza, in Borno State, Nigeria, tells the BBC's Will Ross that Boko Haram fighters tricked the villagers of Attagara before attacking them.

item.title: VIDEO: Tiananmen tense on anniversary
item.description: Chinese security personnel have swamped Beijing's Tiananmen Square on the 25th anniversary of the Beijing massacre.

item.title: Donetsk rebel leaders defiant
item.description: How the Ukrainian city found itself in limbo

item.title: The country that's hooked on tobacco
item.description: The country where nearly two-thirds of men smoke

item.title: How Tiananmen inspires HK youth
item.description: How Tiananmen inspires Hong Kong's young activists

item.title: VIDEO: Brazilian frustration - in numbers
item.description: Brazil's grim mood by the numbers

item.title: Should Facebook keep money from pro-Assad ads?
item.description: Should Facebook keep money from pro-Assad ads?

item.title: France's forgotten Blitz
item.description: France remembers its dead from Allied bombing

item.title: Memories of nursery fire haunt Mexico
item.description: Mexican parents remember nursery fire which killed 49

item.title: How Modi can revive India's economy
item.description: Viewpoint: How India's new PM can revive a flagging economy
